intro: Trigonostemon verrucosus, commonly known as the roughleaf hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to red. The plant belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Trigonostemon verrucosus is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and along stream banks.
